alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Plasma: A state of matter characterized by unbound negative electrons and positive ions that may conduct electrical current. Plasma is often called the fourth state of matter, along with the other three: solids, liquids, and gases.  It is estimated that more than 99 percent of matter in the universe exists as plasma; examples include stars, nebulae, and interstellar particles."

(Burning Plasma, at http://www.nap.edu/openbook.php?record_id=10816&page=188)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Plasma is 99% of Observable Matter - part 06
